text: hey guys it's angel today I'm really
excited because I get to share with you
my walk 101 video now this video is
really meant for those of you who are
first-time wok buyers and are interested
in getting started with wok cooking I'm
going to be talking about the different
types of walks that you guys can
purchase and what works best with your
kitchen stove and I'm also going to show
you how to season and care for your wok
so with that let's get started if you
guys have been following my channel for
a while now you'll know that I have a
round bottom wok now the round bottom
wok is the traditional wok used for
Asian cooking
there is also a flat bottom wok which
has a flat bottom and that's usually the
more common wok in a western-style
kitchen unless you have a stove or a wok
ring that accommodates a round bottom
wok now wok cooking works best with a
gas range because of the high heat and
open flame but you can also use a flat
bottom wok with an electric coil or
glass cooktop as well my wok is made
from carbon steel material which is
similar to cast iron in that you need to
season it first to make it nonstick but
it's a lot thinner which helps with
heating up the food quickly and also
makes it great for stir fries just a
side note if you're shopping for walks
you will see a lot of nonstick walks for
sale now I don't recommend that because
of the nonstick coating you won't be
able to use metal utensils and typically
after a while that nonstick coating is
going to wear off the nonstick coating
that I'm going to show you how to make
when we season the wok in a minute
with love and overtime is just going to
be a much nicer wok once you've decided
on a flat bottom or round bottom wok now
it's time to season your pan and for
that I have an example of a flat bottom
pan that I'm going to show you how to
season this is actually a Joyce Chen pan
that I got it's relatively inexpensive
you can find this online and you can
also find this many times at
the Asian grocery stores now if you buy
one new this is going to be easier for
you but if you found one at a garage
sale or you happen to have one laying
around that's been neglected follow
these steps and I'll show you how to
revive your pan first start with
removing the handles we're going to
unscrew and remove any wood or plastic
that may melt or burn when we go to
place this in the barbecue most wok
should have screws that hold the handles
in place so look out for those next in a
barbecue preheat it to at least 500
degrees place your wok face down and
allow all the debris and any protective
coating to burn off this process of
stripping the pan can take anywhere from
30 minutes to an hour now while you can
do this in a self-cleaning oven I
recommend an outdoor BBQ because new
walks will tend to give off a chemical
smell when being stripped now if you
don't have a barbecue and you don't have
a self-cleaning oven or you just have a
lot of residue on your pan you can also
use a product called Easy Off this also
works really well for cleaning ovens but
it'll definitely strip everything off
your pan once your wok is fairly clean
wash it well with hot soapy water and
give it a good scrub this should be the
last time you wash your pan with soap I
know that sounds weird but I'll have
more on that topic later for now quickly
dry your pan with a lint-free cloth to
prevent it from rusting
then rub a light layer of peanut oil all
over the inside and outside of the wok
just make sure it's a light layer
because a heavy layer of oil may cause
the seasoning to flake off
next back to the barbecue this time
lower the temperature to 400 degrees and
let the oil gently bake onto the pan for
15 to 20 minutes you'll know when it's
ready when the pan turns a dark gray
color and becomes shiny then remove and
let the wok cool for bit so it's cool to
the touch this is going to be our first
layer of seasoning and I recommend that
you repeat the step of adding a light
coating of oil and baking on the
seasoning for a total of two to three
times when you're done the wok should
have started to develop a nice patina
and when you run your finger over it a
pan should feel smooth and glossy next
assemble the handles back on and this
time I'm going to reverse the wooden
handle so the Joyce Chen logo faces the
back now this is just a small tip if you
don't care to see the logo in the front
step two of the seasoning process
requires food to cook with and this is
just sacrificial food for the sake of
breaking in our pan we're not actually
going to eat this I recommend starting
with green onions and ginger because
those flavors will help neutralize any
initial metallic taste from the pan
I also recommend cooking off any expired
fatty meats that you may have in your
fridge or you can also buy same-day
expiring meats on clearance at the
grocery store for this again don't worry
if the meat isn't fresh since it's only
for the seasoning process after three to
four times of cooking with real food
your pan is now ready to use to clean
the wok after cooking just wipe away any
excess oil and residue with the clean
paper towel I know it might sound weird
at first but this is really the best way
to keep your newly seasoned pan happy
you should never wash it with soap and
water
otherwise you'll be stripping away the
nonstick seasoning now if you happen to
cook with something super sticky or food
that is burned on you can clean it with
a bit of kosher salt just rub the salt
into the pan with the paper towel and
like a good skin exfoliation any residue
should come off and any excess oil will
be absorbed by the salt you can then
wipe it clean or rinse the wok under hot
water then immediately dry add a light
layer of oil and heat the pan for a bit
to ensure all the water has evaporated
so those are my tips for walk buying
seasoning and care now if you're like me
you will love the seasoning process
afterwards after i season my new pan I
always love cooking with it more because
it just develops a really nice patina
hopefully some of you out there know
what I mean by that I'm angel thank you
guys so much for watching I hope you
found this wok tutorial helpful as
always post in the comments below if you
have any questions and I will see you
guys soon bye
